tech.description: Technical events focusing on AI, coding, problem-solving, and innovation.

Agent Fusion.title: Agent Fusion
Agent Fusion.description: Agent Fusion is a 3-member AI team challenge where each participant selects a unique AI tool, and in each timed interval only one member works at a time to continue, improve, and complete the shared solution.
rules: Each team must consist of exactly 3 participants.
The total event duration is 1 hour, with participants rotating and working in 10-minute intervals.
All participants are required to bring their own laptops, and each team must carry one extension box for the event.
Participants must use ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude, with each team member assigned a different tool.
Evaluation will be based on the functionality and completeness of the final solution, with additional features considered an added advantage.
Any form of malpractice, including the use of pre-existing GitHub repositories or agentic AI tools that complete the entire task in a single slot, is strictly prohibited.

Paper Podium.title: Paper Podium
Paper Podium.description: A two-round AI-based paper presentation event where teams propose innovative, end-to-end technical solutions to real-world societal problems, focusing on practicality, impact, and business relevance.
rules: Team of 2–4 members.
Level 1 – 10 min presentation | Level 2 – 7 min presentation + 5 min Q&A.
Laptop, two separate PPTs, and prototype or demo video (30–60 sec) for Level 2.
Offline/on-stage presentation using PPT with live or video prototype demo.

Level 1 – Technical design, AI integration & architecture
Level 2 – Real-world application, business value & limitations.
Evaluation is based on innovation, AI relevance, technical clarity, feasibility, business impact, and presentation.
Plagiarism, false claims, or rule violations will lead to immediate disqualification.

Prompt Craft.title: Prompt Craft
Prompt Craft.description: A two-round competition focusing on persuasive AI dialogue and precise image replication.
rules: Teams of 2 members.
The total event duration is 1 hour.
All participants are required to bring their own laptops, and each team must carry one extension box for the event.
The event will be conducted using GenAI models and AI-based technologies as the primary platform.
Round 1 tests your ability to influence AI logic, and Round 2 requires technical prompting to match a visual target.
Evaluation will prioritize the fastest team, provided the final solution is accurate and demonstrates innovation.
Predefined prompts are prohibited and any misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.

HackQuest.title: HackQuest
HackQuest.description: HackQuest is a 3-hour hackathon where teams collaboratively solve real-world problems using coding, creativity, and AI tools.
rules: Maximum 3 participants per team.
Mandatory Requirements: All participants must bring a fully charged laptop, charger/power adapter, and a shared extension box or power strip per team.
The use of AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, GitHub Copilot, and similar platforms is permitted and encouraged during the event.
Solutions will be evaluated based on functionality and completeness, innovation and creativity, code quality, problem-solving approach, presentation, and effective use of technology and AI tools.
Teams will be disqualified for using pre-existing code, starting early, plagiarism, sharing solutions, misconduct, or failing to present on time.

Query Clash.title: Query Clash
Query Clash.description: A SQL-based gamified competitive event aimed at strengthening participant's query-writing and problem-solving skills.
rules: Individual participation (solo event).
The event duration is 1.30 Hours.
The competition consists of two progressive rounds.
Performance is assessed on a points-based scoring system.
Any form of misconduct or malpractice, including copying, will result in immediate disqualification.

Shark Tank.title: Shark Tank
Shark Tank.description: A two-round startup event where teams pitch their business idea and then convince live judges acting as clients to back their vision and financial plan.
rules: Maximum 4 participants per team.
Round 1 lasts 8 minutes. Round 2 is about 20 minutes, but judges can adjust that time if needed.
Round 1 will be on-stage, using a PPT presentation. Round 2 will be a simulation-based round for startups.
Round 1: A 6-slide PPT presentation. Round 2: A simulation where judges act as clients and participants pitch their ideas directly to them.
Evaluation will be based on timing, the clarity of the idea, and the business use case.
Plagiarism, rule violations, or false claims will result in immediate disqualification.

nontech.description: Non-technical events focusing on creativity, entertainment, and team collaboration.

Auction Arena.title: Auction Arena
Auction Arena.description: A competitive, strategy-based cricket event designed to test participant's IPL knowledge, decision-making skills, and auction strategy.
rules: Team participation (4-5 members per team).
The event consists of two rounds: Rapid Fire and IPL Auction.
All registered teams/participants must compulsorily attend Round 1 (Rapid Fire Round).
Teams eliminated in Round 1 are free to participate in other events and will not proceed further in this event.
Only the top 10 selected teams from Round 1 will advance to Round 2 (IPL Auction Round).
The use of smartphones or any electronic devices is strictly prohibited during Round 1.
Registered participants are expected to be aware of other event timings. Once a team qualifies for Round 2, they must continue participating throughout the event.

Battle Of Thrones.title: Battle Of Thrones
Battle Of Thrones.description: A fast-paced eSports competition where duo teams battle it out in Free Fire and PUBG to prove skill, strategy, and teamwork.
rules: Each team must consist of 2 players (Duo only).
The total event duration is approximately 2–3 hours, depending on match progress.
Participants must bring their own mobile device, stable internet connection, earphones, and a fully charged phone.
The event will be conducted online using Free Fire and PUBG.
The event consists of multiple knockout rounds, with top-performing duos advancing to the final match.
Teams are evaluated based on kills, survival time, teamwork, and overall match performance.
Any use of hacks, cheats, abusive behavior, or unfair play will result in immediate disqualification.

Beyond The Gate.title: Beyond The Gate
Beyond The Gate.description: Beyond the Gate is a Stranger Things–themed, non-technical interactive game where teams solve puzzles, decode clues, and complete story-based challenges across multiple rounds.
rules: Each team consists of 4–5 members.
A total of 20 teams will participate in the initial round, with 10 teams in the morning batch and 10 teams in the afternoon batch.
The event duration is 1 hr 30 mins.
This is an indoor and outdoor event.
The game includes 5 eliminator rounds, featuring puzzles, decoding tasks, memory challenges, and story-driven missions.
The event will be conducted in two batches: morning and afternoon.
One winning team from each batch will be selected.
The batch winners will compete in a final task to determine the overall winner.
A tie-breaker task will be conducted if required.
Teams will be evaluated based on accuracy, teamwork, communication, effective clue usage, and time management.
The game concludes with teams attempting to close the Gate, with winners decided by coordination, correctness, and least completion time.
Any form of misconduct, cheating, or rule violation will lead to immediate disqualification.

Cinefrenzy.title: Cinefrenzy
Cinefrenzy.description: A royal fantasy–themed cinematic game designed to test movie knowledge, observation skills, and creative thinking.
rules: Team participation with 2–3 members per team.
The event consists of three progressive rounds:
Prop-o-pedia: Movies are identified using visual clues displayed on the screen; the fastest team to press the buzzer gets the chance to answer.
Dialography: One team member reads a famous movie dialogue in a neutral tone while the other identifies the movie.
Bio to Blockbuster: Movies are presented through an Instagram-style profile with bio, profile picture, and following list as clues.
Performance is evaluated using a points-based scoring system, with bonus points for speed and accuracy.

Flashback.title: Flashback
Flashback.description: A non-technical, memory-based competitive event aimed at testing participant's visual observation, recall ability, and teamwork skills.
rules: Team participation (2–3 members per team).
The event consists of three progressive rounds.
A total of 20 teams will participate in the initial round.
Performance is assessed based on accuracy, recall, communication, and time efficiency.
The event concludes with two winning teams.
Any form of misconduct or violation of event rules will result in immediate disqualification.

Rhythmia.title: Rhythmia
Rhythmia.description: A non-technical musical event where tunes, lyrics, and rhythm come together in a fun and competitive way.
rules: Each team may have 2–3 participants.
The event consists of three progressive rounds:
Round 1: Track the Trio – Listen to the tune and identify the actor, actress, and music director behind it.
Round 2: Move & Match – No lyrics, no music—just moves! Watch the hook step, match the song, and prove your rhythm sense.
Round 3: Lyric Quest – Plain lyrics, sometimes translated, are displayed. Participants must recall the tune, identify the song, and sing it.
Teams that qualify in each round will proceed to the next round.
The use of mobile phones, smart devices, or any external assistance is strictly prohibited during the event.
Any form of misconduct or violation of event rules will result in immediate disqualification.
The judges decisions are final.

DOthethink.title: Short Film Contest
DOthethink.description: Create and submit an original short film based on the given theme.
rules: Maximum duration: 5 minutes
Any genre allowed
Original content only
